contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} {{Infobox Website | name = XBOX365 | favicon = | logo = | caption = Xbox All Day, Every Day | url = http://www.xbox365.com/ | commercial = | type = Gaming | registration = Optional | owner = [[Penton Media]] | author = Jason Brown | launch date = [[2000 in video gaming|2000]] | current status = Inactive | revenue = }} '''Xbox365''' was the longest running gaming media web site dedicated to the [[Microsoft]] [[Xbox]] and [[Xbox 360]] platforms.{{fact|date=May 2008}} Launching 12 months before the November 2001 launch of the console, XBOX365 attained notoriety on the Xbox campus at Microsoft with a series of insider articles detailing the inner workings of the console. Main stream news coverage included [[MSNBC]], the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' and ''[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]'' tabloid newspaper in the UK. Xbox365 was founded in [[2000 in video gaming|2000]] by Jason "UtahSaint" Brown and Paul "Gemini" Gurnhill. The site was purchased by [[Penton Media]] in 2004 and merged into the Connected Home division. The site remains focused on the Xbox 360 and Xbox platforms with an active fan-base of over 50,000 registered members discussing other Consoles and Gaming devices, Art and Entertainment, Political forum, Sports and Auto forum, Electronics and the famous Off Topic Lounge. ==References== *[http://www.theregister.co.uk/2000/11/06/xbox_blueprint_leaked Xbox Blue Prints Leaked] *[http://www.xbox365.com/stories/xdkcomplete.shtml Xbox XDK Leaked] {{reflist}} [[Category:Xbox]] [[Category:Video game Internet forums]] [[Category:Video game news websites]] [[Category:Video game review websites]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2000]] [[Category:Video game platform websites]] {{videogame-website-stub}} {{xbox-stub}}
